titles.title: Bikini Resettlement and Relocation Act of 1999
Bikini Resettlement and Relocation Act of 2000

To assist in the resettlement and relocation of the people of Bikini Atoll by amending the terms of the trust fund established during the United States administration of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 106-267.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 159.

action.text: Mr. Sherwood moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2368.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 106-240.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 456.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/29/1999--Introduced. Bikini Resettlement and Relocation Act of 1999 - Makes a specified percentage of funds from the Resettlement Trust Fund for the People of Bikini available for immediate ex gratia distribution to the people of Bikini (provided such distribution does not reduce the corpus of the Fund). Requires such distribution to be deducted from any additional ex gratia payments that may be made by Congress into the Fund.
